subsection_content:
The most effective way to prevent gout is to pay attention to diet and lifestyle. If someone in your family has had gout, you should perform regular examination tests in addition to paying attention to:
Weight control: Weight affects the progression of the disease, a reasonable weight helps reduce increased uric acid and reduces pressure on joints; Proper nutrition: Limiting foods high in purine is a top priority, in addition to needing to supplement enough water and fiber as well as protein sources from beans, eggs, milk and limit beer, spirits, and other foods. carbonated water; Healthy lifestyle: Exercising and participating in outdoor activities is an ideal way to improve your health and avoid high-intensity work that puts pressure on your health. On the other hand, proactively have regular health check-ups every 6 months to detect disease and treat gout early.
